column4: so has anyone configured wpa_supplicant so that it runs with rcS scripts... so that the wireless card is associated before rc40networking runs?  The reason is that my laptop hands on "Configuring network interfaces..." during boot until I ctrl-c it... or it times out.
Since it seems you have some knowledge in the area, do you know how to move gdm to a later start # in /etc/rc2.d/?
Someone suggested it and I have no idea what that means.
that was directed to you... sorry
Something like instead of S13gdm, maybe S23gdm?  Does it much matter what to?
the first directory that is evalutaed on boot is /etc/rcS.d/    it then goes through the appropriate /etc/rc#.d directory... according to the run level yer in... (default is 2 in Ubuntu)....
What is the purpose in life for levels 3-5?
well.. in Ubuntu.. they're all the same as level 2...  but you can choose to have yer system run certain things in one runlevel than you would in others....
And then set up different grub options for each of them, so you could boot according to your needs for that session?
Cool.  Will have to try that some time.
I don't think that's actually solving my issue there.
wait... yer console switching is disabled with the invocation of gdm?  describe problem.
eh... thats the only one I know of... like that anyway....   :-P
Me, for some ridiculous reason.  (3am here)
Last ditch attempts to figure out if I can fix some things.
